info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 2:43PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Beneficial Rains Looking Increasingly Likely Over Northern and Portions of Central Arkansas in the Coming Days... ...Beneficial Rains Looking Increasingly Likely Over Northern and Portions of Central Arkansas in the Coming Days... ...Localized Heavy Rainfall Possible... Scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms are expected over northern and central Arkansas tonight into Friday as a weakening surface front interacts with a warm air mass and dissipates. A stronger frontal boundary will move into Arkansas and stall out over the weekend. Several disturbances will move through and interact with the stalling boundary, with additional showers and thunderstorms expected to continue into the early part of next week. At this time, it appears that rainfall accumulations tonight through Monday Night over northern and central Arkansas could reach two to four inches, with localized heavier amounts. Based on the latest data, it also appears that the most widespread showers and storms will affect the area Saturday, Saturday Night, and Sunday with the heaviest rainfall likely. While rainfall has been significantly deficient in much of the state in the last couple of months, localized heavy rainfall potential is becoming more of a concern in the coming days. A high amount of moisture in the atmosphere, as well as the tendency of stronger thunderstorms to form and move repeatedly over the same areas could prove too much for the dry ground in spots. This would be especially true in areas of higher terrain in the Ozark and Ouachita Mountains. Rainfall accumulations will largely depend on where the anticipated frontal boundary stalls over the weekend. If the front ends up stalling further southward, heavier rainfall amounts will become more likely in a larger area. Please continue to monitor forecasts and statements from your local National Weather Service forecast offices over the next few days for the latest information.
